confirmation.message:
Thank you for completing the International Conference Faculty Sponsorship Form. You will be contacted by the ACG office if additional information is required. Your request will be reviewed at either the June or October International Relations Committee Meeting depending upon when your application was submitted. You will be notified regarding the status of your request within 30 days following the committee meeting.

If you have any questions, please contact Maria Susano in the ACG office at msusano@acg.gi.org.

The information you submitted is below.

7.title: Year End Governors' Report
7.description:
American College of Gastroenterology
Annual Governors' Report
Fall 2017/Spring 2018

DEADLINE April 27, 2018

fields.label: Please list any ACG sponsored CME courses, other courses for physicians or courses for the lay public which you have helped sponsor or in which you have participated as a speaker or moderator.
Have you written welcoming letters to new members?
Please list ACG Committees on which you are currently serving.
Have you participated in ACG special projects?
Please list and discuss any special issues regarding the practice of gastroenterology in your territory.
Any advice for the College? Anything the College could do to make your job easier?

fields.description: Please attach a brief statement citing specific reasons for the nomination. Click here for a list of current Governors and their awards eligibility.
fields.label: Nominations for awards (see criteria below).

fields.description: To be eligible to receive the Freshman Governor's Award the nominee must be in the first term of service as Governor. Nominees must demonstrate a clear commitment of service to the Board and show potential for future growth within the organization. Level of involvement in Board activities will be assessed, such as service on ad hoc committees, national affairs, local and state legislative efforts, recruitment, correspondence with constituents, participation in regional meetings, speakers bureau or other special projects.
fields.label: Freshman Governors' Award

fields.description: To be eligible to receive the Senior Governor's Award nominees must be in the second term of service as Governor. Candidates must demonstrate a strong commitment to the Board of Governors in various areas such as service on ad hoc committees, national affairs, local and state legislative efforts, recruitment, correspondence with constituents, participation in regional meetings, speakers bureau or other special projects.
fields.label: Senior Governors' Award

fields.description:
Dr. William D. Carey was elected Governor for Northern Ohio in 1987 and served as Chairman of the Board of Governors from 1988-1990. He has served the College as Treasurer and Trustee, and has chaired numerous College Committees. Dr. Carey is the first Chairman of the Board of Governors to be elected as President of the American College of Gastroenterology (1993). In honor of his years of distinguished service and because of the example he has set for other Governors an award will be given in his name.

This award will be reserved for an exceptional individual who has served the Board and the College with distinction. Nominees must show clear demonstration of outstanding contribution to the College such as service within leadership positions, participation in educational efforts, committee service or participation in research related activities. Governors serving their final term or those emeritus Governors who have completed service will be eligible to receive the award. Nominees must have a strong history of meritorious service to the Board of Governors.
fields.label: The William D. Carey Award

confirmations.message: Thank you for submitting your report.
confirmations.name: Default Confirmation

16.title: Instructions:
16.description:
ACG’s SCOPY: Service Award for Colorectal Cancer Outreach, Prevention & Year-Round Excellence recognizes the achievements of ACG members in their community engagement, education and awareness efforts for colorectal cancer prevention. ACG members are invited to submit examples of projects and programs that demonstrate outstanding creativity and commitment to spreading the potentially lifesaving message of the importance of colorectal cancer screening and prevention.

Projects and activities eligible for consideration include: any events, materials and outreach efforts sponsored, implemented or created between January 1, 2018 and May 31, 2018 to raise colorectal cancer awareness. The deadline for submissions for the 2018 SCOPY Awards is May 31, 2018. The College challenges you to rally your office staff, colleagues, fellows and your most creative ideas in support of the ACG SCOPY Awards.

Learn more about the SCOPY Awards

View the 2017 SCOPY Awards Booklet

Award Criteria

  • Scientific accuracy
  • Potential public health impact
  • Educational value
  • High number of online views
  • Originality

Rules

  • Submissions must be sponsored, implemented or created between January 1, 2018 and May 31, 2018.
  • Signed releases are required for everyone in video or photo.
  • Videos should be two minutes or less.
  • No trademark/copyright infringements, including the use of copyrighted music.
  • No profanity/no nudity.

To Apply

To submit your application for the SCOPY Awards, please complete this form and upload any photos, videos, images or documents. Please send questions to mediaonly@gi.org

18.title: ACG Edgar Achkar Visiting Professorship Application Original
18.description:
To Apply:

To submit your application for the ACG Edgar Achkar Visiting Professorship, please complete this form, and upload a letter addressed to the ACG President, and ACG Institute Director. For questions email: nshaheen@gi.org

Evaluation Criteria:

The ACG Institute aims to support visits to a diverse group of programs, with respect to program size, areas of faculty expertise, and geographic dispersion. We also seek to provide experts in a variety of disciplines in clinical gastroenterology. Our goal is to provide not only world class education, but also an intimate atmosphere for informal mentoring and role modeling. By bringing motivated trainees together with successful academic clinicians, we hope to encourage the development of the next generation of leaders in gastroenterology.

The Institute will assess the degree to which the proposed visit meets the objectives and goals of the ACG Edgar Achkar Visiting Professorship program. Applications from North American GI Training programs will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

  • The degree to which the training program documents and demonstrates an unmet need for the visit in their training program.
  • The extent to which the proposed speaker(s) fulfill this unmet need.
  • The commitment of the training program to promote the event locally. In particular, we expect the recipient institution to coordinate events in such as a way as to include community GI practitioners, whether through a local gut club event or by inviting them to the GI grand rounds.

fields.label: Best Days of the week for a visit:
Potential dates:
fields.description: Please list three dates in 2017 and provide at least a month lead time

fields.label: Potential Speakers:
fields.description: You may identify up to three; there is no guarantee that we can fulfill the exact request, given limitations of schedules and travel requirements

fields.label: Do you plan to ask the Visiting Professor to give a Gut Club-style educational presentation while in your community?
If yes, how will this be financially supported and advertised?
Anticipated Activities for the Visiting Professor:

choices.text: One-on-one appointments with faculty to discuss research/mentoring
choices.value: One-on-one appointments with faculty to discuss research/mentoring

fields.label: If revision of project, approximate submission date and name of previous project:
Desired Delivery Date:
fields.description:
We encourage no more than three drafts so please proof carefully.

NOTE: There is a minimum turnaround of 10 working days for small projects (2-3 pages/panels or less). Depending on current projects the design team is working on, the time to complete a project may be longer, even if small jobs. Projects greater than 3 pages/panels will require additional time and an estimated delivery date will be provided after review of all project files.

32.title: ACG Clinical Guideline Topic and Author Nomination Form
32.description:
The ACG Practice Parameters Committee invites ACG members to submit topic and author suggestions for consideration for new clinical guidelines. Click here for a list of current Guidelines

Please note the following requirements for authorship:
  • • Active member of ACG
  • • Considered an opinion leader in the topic/field as determined by literature review
  • • Considered a nationally recognized expert based on conference participation/leadership
  • • Minimum of 5 publications on the topic
The topic and author nominations will be reviewed by the Practice Parameters Committee. Self-nominations will be considered. Nominations will be open until July 31.

NOTE: You must complete the form, fill out the Captcha box at the bottom and click the Submit button in order for your nomination to be received.

notifications.name: Admin Notification
notifications.subject: ACG Guideline Topic and Author Suggestion

confirmations.message: Thank you for your submission. Your nomination will be shared with the Practice Parameters Committee.
confirmations.name: Default Confirmation

confirmations.name: Default Confirmation
confirmations.message: Thank you for registering for the Gastroenterology Regulatory Endpoints and the Advancement of Therapeutics (GREAT) Workshop for Pediatric Irritable Bowel Syndrome and Pediatric Functional Constipation Workshop.   Please find below some information on GREAT V and getting to the FDA   Date:   March 28, 2018   Time:   8 AM to 5 PM (eastern)   Location: White Oak Campus, Food and Drug Administration, Silver Spring, MD FAQs: Public Meetings at FDA White Oak Campus   More Background The American College of Gastroenterology (ACG), American Gastroenterological Association (AGA), North American Society for Pediatric Gastroenterology, Hepatology, and Nutrition (NASPGHAN) and FDA will be cosponsoring a public workshop.   Live streaming of the presentations may be accessed at https://collaboration.fda.gov/greatv/ for remote attendees. Transcripts of the presentations for the Pediatric Irritable Bowel Syndrome and Pediatric Functional Constipation will be available within 30 days following the workshop. For questions related to registration, please email GREAT@fda.hhs.gov   Please click here for information on the venue, local hotels and FDA campus security procedures
